metadata.title: CVE-2017-9260 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The TDStretchSSE::calcCrossCorr function insource/SoundTouch/sse_optimized.cpp in SoundTouch 1.9.2 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read andapplication crash) via a crafted wav file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9260` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsoundtouch0 - 1.7.1-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
soundstretch - 1.7.1-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: soundtouch package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.1-5ubuntu0.1~esm1').
